wikipedia_page.main: Charles Millington (25 April 1882 – 22 June 1945) was an English professional footballer who played for Aston Villa, Fulham and Birmingham in the Football League. He played mainly as an outside right, and was noted for his pace.

response: Ian Scott Hastie (1887 – after 1911) was an English professional footballer born in London who played in the Football League for Birmingham. Hastie joined Birmingham from junior football in north London in May 1911, and made his debut on 18 November 1911, standing in for regular outside right Charlie Millington in a 2–0 defeat away at Clapton Orient.Matthews, p. 158. This was the only first-team game that Hastie, a good dribbler but lacking awareness of the game as a whole, played for the club before leaving for Wycombe Wanderers at the end of the 1911–12 season.

Twenty-six players made at least one appearance in nationally organised first-team competition, and there were ten different goalscorers. Forward Charlie Millington played in 36 of the 39 matches over the season, and half-back Albert Gardner appeared in one fewer. Walter Freeman was leading scorer with 10 goals, all of which came in the league.
